poem:
Title: "A Day in Trade"

In the lace-edged morn, FTSE marks its peak,
A dance of digits, investors at the steeple.
Anglo takes no rivals, strong, not weak,
As numbers whisper secrets to the people.
Electric dreamers, on silent wheels they ride,
Their price for progress, steep and yet stalled.
Night settles on City, pride at high tide,
In the ledger of life, every action tallied, all audited and called.
